issue.title: Adjust staff line Spacing
issue.body:
hi, the default spacing between staff line is too large, how can i decrease this spacing? thank you very much
![exmaple](https://github.com/59lou/TempImageStore/blob/04e42c23133a1b7e395e03a157e17e2a0a9002e8/exmaple_1.png?raw=true)

issue.title: Adjust staff line Spacing
issue.body:
hi, the default spacing between staff line is too large, how can i decrease this spacing? thank you very much
![exmaple](https://github.com/59lou/TempImageStore/blob/04e42c23133a1b7e395e03a157e17e2a0a9002e8/exmaple_1.png?raw=true)

comment.body:
You can try some of these settings, mainly:
`osmd.EngravingRules.MinSkyBottomDistBetweenSystems = 2`

This should be enough, but you can try some other "Between" settings:
```js
MinimumDistanceBetweenSystems
BetweenStaffDistance
MinSkyBottomDistBetweenSystems
```

etc.

forkee.name: opensheetmusicdisplay
forkee.description: OpenSheetMusicDisplay renders sheet music in MusicXML format in your web browser based on VexFlow. OSMD is brought to you by PhonicScore.com.

issue.title: midi to music xml

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: a (small) improvement that neither adds nor fixes a significant feature

issue.body:
Hi there,

as far as I can tell there isn't any support in this project for inputing midi files but maybe I missed something?

Of course midi is not about making sheet music whereas musicxml is, but I was wondering if anyone knew of a tool to scaffold raw midi to music xml?

I found this site: http://flashmusicgames.com/midi/mid2xml.php but after uploading a simple midi file, osmd could not parse it; it's not valid.

comment.body: For simple music, https://github.com/kamshory/PHPMusicXML can convert music from MIDI to MusicXML.

commits.message:
add option to apply padding to last note in the measure as well (default false, usually unnecessary)

this is only necessary in rare cases where there are last notes in a measure with very long lyrics text

issue.title: Improve Shortening length of measures with long lyrics on short notes
issue.body: Improvement on #1394. Still not perfect, but better. visual regression diffs: [current-lyrics-measurelength8_PaddingFactor1.0_commit.zip](https://github.com/opensheetmusicdisplay/opensheetmusicdisplay/files/12969270/current-lyrics-measurelength8_PaddingFactor1.0_commit.zip) West Point got shortened the most, due to less measure elongation factor needed: ![image](https://github.com/opensheetmusicdisplay/opensheetmusicdisplay/assets/33069673/ccebd0bf-bd34-497a-abde-1be8f9fceed8) Some samples also need slightly more space now though, due to a lower threshold for activating the padding: ![image](https://github.com/opensheetmusicdisplay/opensheetmusicdisplay/assets/33069673/78f81127-b002-4566-91fa-0360da4f0e41) This could be avoided by adding some checks, like whether there are no lyrics on the next note (then skip padding). Almost all affected scores are shorter though, I think the above is the only one that's longer. --- There's a slight issue with the png generation in the generateImages script using less padding, probably because the text is somehow measured to be shorter, but I'd categorize that as jsdom wonkiness. That's not the only imperfection in jsdom/png generation, and you can just increase `EngravingRules.LyricsXPaddingWidthThreshold` for this case. Most visible in Parlez Moi: ![image](https://github.com/opensheetmusicdisplay/opensheetmusicdisplay/assets/33069673/e2bd21a6-c356-4590-8104-0a94323d6f74) (`quide et` are two syllables, like this, in SVG:) also Mozart - Chloe depending on settings: ![image](https://github.com/opensheetmusicdisplay/opensheetmusicdisplay/assets/33069673/12cea7c3-7c85-4c8b-934f-c32a79efa0b7)

comment.body:
Actually scores can be longer if `RenderSingleHorizontalStaffline` isn't used and you don't set `osmd.EngravingRules.MaximumLyricsElongationFactor = 1.0`, which I had locally.
With `RenderSingleHorizontalStaffline` false and max factor 1.0 there can still be overlaps.
max factor 1.2 looks good, but still sometimes uses slightly more space than before.
Will need more investigation.

pull_request.title: Improve Shortening length of measures with long lyrics on short notes
pull_request.body: Improvement on #1394. Still not perfect, but better. visual regression diffs: [current-lyrics-measurelength8_PaddingFactor1.0_commit.zip](https://github.com/opensheetmusicdisplay/opensheetmusicdisplay/files/12969270/current-lyrics-measurelength8_PaddingFactor1.0_commit.zip) West Point got shortened the most, due to less measure elongation factor needed: ![image](https://github.com/opensheetmusicdisplay/opensheetmusicdisplay/assets/33069673/ccebd0bf-bd34-497a-abde-1be8f9fceed8) Some samples also need slightly more space now though, due to a lower threshold for activating the padding: ![image](https://github.com/opensheetmusicdisplay/opensheetmusicdisplay/assets/33069673/78f81127-b002-4566-91fa-0360da4f0e41) This could be avoided by adding some checks, like whether there are no lyrics on the next note (then skip padding). Almost all affected scores are shorter though, I think the above is the only one that's longer. --- There's a slight issue with the png generation in the generateImages script using less padding, probably because the text is somehow measured to be shorter, but I'd categorize that as jsdom wonkiness. That's not the only imperfection in jsdom/png generation, and you can just increase `EngravingRules.LyricsXPaddingWidthThreshold` for this case. Most visible in Parlez Moi: ![image](https://github.com/opensheetmusicdisplay/opensheetmusicdisplay/assets/33069673/e2bd21a6-c356-4590-8104-0a94323d6f74) (`quide et` are two syllables, like this, in SVG:) also Mozart - Chloe depending on settings: ![image](https://github.com/opensheetmusicdisplay/opensheetmusicdisplay/assets/33069673/12cea7c3-7c85-4c8b-934f-c32a79efa0b7)

repo.name: opensheetmusicdisplay
repo.description: OpenSheetMusicDisplay renders sheet music in MusicXML format in your web browser based on VexFlow. OSMD is brought to you by PhonicScore.com.

commits.message:
set XPaddingFactor = 1 instead of 0.8, rebalance around that

the factor 0.8 was making it so that long strings have too little padding, needing the awkward padding *= 1.15 workaround.
This also makes it less volatile to increase the factor e.g. to 1.1.
alternate padding calculation: additive instead of multiplicative. much tighter for 16th notes with long lyrics

issue.title: Issues with Noteflight XML files
issue.body:
Hello @sschmidTU and team.

I am trying to understand why OSMD is throwing an error when importing the attached XML file I have exported from Noteflight. MuseScore imports it correctly, even though it is giving a warning that the file is "not valid."

Here is the error I get:

`demo.min.js:2 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'StaffEntries')`

Thoughts?

Thanks.

[Sonata in C.xml.zip](https://github.com/opensheetmusicdisplay/opensheetmusicdisplay/files/12898574/Sonata.in.C.xml.zip)

issue.title: Can OSMD write bold text corrrrectly?
issue.body:
Hello @sschmidTU and team.

I have just submitted a pull request to add a few tempo indications to the InstantaneousTempoExpression.ts because some key tempos, such as "Maestoso" or "Allegro assai" weren't included:

https://github.com/opensheetmusicdisplay/opensheetmusicdisplay/pull/1471

I am also wondering about any other possible tempo that, at least from the "graphical" standpoint, I think should always be written in bold text. So, I am suggesting updating OSMD to follow the `font-weight='bold'` attribute of <words>, whenever that's present. It looks like that's ignored, and instead, unrecognized tempos, even if defined with a "bold" face, are always written in Italics.

You can try the attached file, which includes the "Maestoso" tempo for your reference.

Thoughts welcome!

Thanks :)



[03Joy_to_the_World.musicxml.zip](https://github.com/opensheetmusicdisplay/opensheetmusicdisplay/files/12875426/03Joy_to_the_World.musicxml.zip)

comment.body: Simon, I have updated the code and that pull request to parse the "font-weight" attribute to show bolded text correctly. Please, let me know if I forgot anything. Thanks!

issue.title: Update InstantaneousTempoExpression.ts
issue.body: Added extra tempo indications such as "Maestoso", "Animato" and "Allegro Assai"

comment.body: I have also added the ability to parse the "font-weight" attribute to show bolded text correctly.

issue.title: Can OSMD write bold text corrrrectly?
issue.body:
Hello @sschmidTU and team.

I have just submitted a pull request to add a few tempo indications to the InstantaneousTempoExpression.ts because some key tempos, such as "Maestoso" or "Allegro assai" weren't included:

https://github.com/opensheetmusicdisplay/opensheetmusicdisplay/pull/1471

I am also wondering about any other possible tempo that, at least from the "graphical" standpoint, I think should always be written in bold text. So, I am suggesting updating OSMD to follow the `font-weight='bold'` attribute of <words>, whenever that's present. It looks like that's ignored, and instead, unrecognized tempos, even if defined with a "bold" face, are always written in Italics.

You can try the attached file, which includes the "Maestoso" tempo for your reference.

Thoughts welcome!

Thanks :)



[03Joy_to_the_World.musicxml.zip](https://github.com/opensheetmusicdisplay/opensheetmusicdisplay/files/12875426/03Joy_to_the_World.musicxml.zip)
